page.title: 02DEVERALL FARM
page.content: Deverall Farm,covering 140 acres, is one of the largest farms in the area.It is a family concern employing 3 full-time staff and 2-3 casual labourers most of the year round.The land is divided between horticultural crops,silage,and grazing for beef and dairy herds.There are 80 head of cattle,30 of which are for beef,the rest for milking.The land is farmed on a 3 year rotation system: potatoes, cabbage and brocilli are grown for 2 years followed by corn in the 3rd year.For the next 3 years grass is grown for grazing and cutting for silage for winter fodder for the cattle.Much of the horticultural produce is packed and sent to markets out of Cornwall.Although the farm is completely mechanised for management of the land and milking,the farmer works very long hours in the summer.
